document.masterDocTitle: A review of the stink bug genus Plautia Stål from Japan (Hemiptera, Heteroptera, Pentatomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of the stink bug genus Plautia Stål from Japan (Hemiptera, Heteroptera, Pentatomidae)

heading.emphasis:
Plautia ishigaki
Ishikawa & Moriya, sp. nov.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 63–67.
Plautia
spp., apical part of phallus in posterior view. 63,
P. stali
; 64,
P. sakishimensis
sp. nov.
; 65,
P. splendens
; 66,
P. himechabane
sp. nov.
; 67,
P. ishigaki
sp. nov.
Scale bars: 0.1 mm. Lettering: cp = conjunctival process; de = dorsal expansion; pve = process of vesica; ve = vesica.

subSubSection.paragraph: Structure. Head finely punctate, weakly and densely rugose, a little more than 3/4 as long as width across eyes; interocular space approximately 3 times as wide as eye in dorsal view. Bucculae roundly convex ventrad in anterior 1/3, pointed at anterior 1/5, gradually tapering posteriad in posterior 2/3. Antenna 3/4 as long as body length (to apex of abdomen), sparsely covered with short, erect and suberect setae in segments I, II and basal half of III, and densely in segments IV, V and apical half of III; approximate proportion of segments I to V 1.0: 1.7: 2.0: 2.9: 3.1. Labium reaching abdominal segment III; approximate proportion of segments I to IV 1.0: 1.6: 1.4: 1.1.

subSubSection.paragraph: Measurements [in mm, ♂ (n=7) / ♀ (n=16). Body length 6.7–7.8 ( holotype 7.4) / 7.5–8.8; width across eyes 2.1–2.4 / 2.3–2.5; width across humeral width 4.7–5.3 / 5.1–5.8; maximum width of abdomen 4.6–5.1 / 5.1–5.3.

All the paratypes were collected by light traps
.
Distribution. Ishigaki-jima Island of the Ryukyu Islands, Japan .
Etymology. The specific epithet is named for the type locality, Ishigaki-jima Island, one of islands in the Ryukyu Islands, Japan ; a noun in apposition.

Remarks. In general appearance, this new species is very similar to
P . crossota (Dallas, 1851)
. However,
P . ishigaki
sp. nov.
is distinguished from
P . crossota
by its relatively smaller body length (6.7–8.8 mm vs. 8.0–11.0 mm), the lateral margins of pronotum brownish ( Fig. 27 ) (vs. blackish), the middle part of the ventral rim of genital capsule roundly concave ( Fig. 32 ) (vs. slightly convex), and the lateral lobe of the crown of paramere truncate at apex ( Fig. 47 ) (vs. triangularly projected).
